text.title: Check an SSL Certificate
text.head: Check an SSL Certificate
text.p: This wikiHow teaches you how to verify a website's SSL certificate in a web browser on a computer, phone, or tablet. The steps are slightly different depending on your browser and operating system.
text.head: Steps
Google Chrome for Windows and macOS

list.item: Open Chrome. You'll usually find it in the All Apps section of the Start menu (Windows) or the Applications folder (macOS).

Navigate to the website with the certificate you want to check. To get there, type the URL into the address bar at the top of the screen and press or . You can also search for a website in your search engine of choice.
Click the lock icon. It's to the left of the address bar at the top of Chrome. It should say ″Secure″ beside it. A pop-up message will appear, telling you whether the certificate is secure.
Click . It's near the middle of the pop-up. This opens the certificate for you to view.
Review the certificate. All information you'll need is on the three tabs. Click through the tabs to find what you're looking for.
Click when you're done. This closes the certificate window.

text.head: Google Chrome for Android and iOS

list.item:
Open Chrome. It's the blue, green, yellow, and red circle icon labeled ″Chrome″ in the app drawer (Android) or on the home screen (iPhone/iPad).
The iPhone/iPad version of Chrome does not show as many details about the certificate as the Android version.
Navigate to the website with the certificate you want to check. To do this, enter the URL into the address bar at the top of the screen and click the Go or Enter button.

Tap the padlock icon. It's in the address bar beside the URL. This displays whether or not the connection is secure, and who assigned the SSL certificate.
If you're using an iPhone or iPad, this is all the information you'll be able to see.
If you have an Android, continue to the next step in this method.
Tap . It's in the pop-up that appeared.
Tap . It's below the name of the certificate issuer. Now you'll see the certificate's details.

text.head: Mozilla Firefox for Windows and macOS

list.item:
Open Firefox on your computer. You'll usually find it under All Apps in the Windows start menu, or in your Mac's Applications folder.
It's not possible to view SSL certificates in Firefox for Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you're using Firefox on your mobile phone or tablet, navigate to https://www.digicert.com/help, enter the domain name, then tap CHECK SERVER.

Navigate to the website with the certificate you want to check. To get there, type the URL into the address bar at the top of the screen and press or . You can also search for a website in your search engine of choice.
Click the green lock icon. It's inside the address bar at the top of Firefox on the far-left side. A pop-up menu will expand.
Click the right-pointing arrow next to the website's name. This opens the ″Site Security″ menu below the lock icon.
Click . Additional security details will appear.
Click . It's the button in the ″Web Security″ section. This displays all pertinent details of the SSL certificate for your review.

text.head: Safari for macOS

list.item: Open Safari on your Mac. It's the compass icon on the Dock.

Navigate to the website with the certificate you want to check. To get there, type the URL into the address bar at the top of the screen and press . You can also search for a website in your search engine of choice.
Click the padlock icon. It's in the address bar at the top of Safari. A drop-down box will appear.
Click . This is where you'll find additional info about the certificate, including when it was issued, who it was issued by, when it expires, and whether it's valid.
Click to close the window. It's in the bottom-right corner of the certificate window.

text.head: Safari for iPhone and iPad

list.item:
Open Safari on your iPhone or iPad. It's the compass icon that's typically found on the home screen.
Safari for iOS does not come with a built-in way to view an SSL certificate in the app, but you can use a certificate verification website as a workaround.
Navigate to https://www.digicert.com/help. This opens a website that can check SSL certificates for any accessible site.
Enter the URL of the site you want to check. You can type just the domain (e.g. wikihow.com).
Tap . It's right below the blank.
Scroll down to see the results. You'll find all of the certificate's information, including its issuer, expiration date, and other pertinent details.

text.head: Microsoft Edge for Windows

list.item: Open Edge. It's the ″e″ icon in the Start menu. You may also find it on the desktop.

Navigate to the website with the certificate you want to check. To get there, type the URL into the address bar at the top of the screen and press . You can also search for a website in your search engine of choice.
Click the black and white padlock. It's on the left side of the address bar at the top of the screen. A menu with information about the website will appear.
Click . The certificate information will appear on the right side of the screen. Some browsers may not require this step.
